explanation: Not correct. Agent A’s reasoning conflates unreachable and dead code and ignores the control flow that makes the mhd_assert(0) occurrences unreachable in normal builds. MISRA 2.2 forbids dead code (code that is executed but removable without changing behaviour). An assertion macro defined as #define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0) makes mhd_assert(…) a no-op when it is reached, but in this function the places containing mhd_assert(0) are defensive ‘‘impossible’’ fallback branches: earlier code either (a) assigns a valid s_algo or (b) takes an early return (and so control never reaches the later mhd_assert sites). Unreachable code is explicitly excluded from MISRA 2.2’s definition of dead code, so those assertion statements are not violations in the project configuration where they are unreachable. If, contrary to design, those paths could be reached at run time while the macro is a no-op, then the statements would be redundant no-ops and would meet the definition of dead code — but that would indicate a different logic problem; it is not the situation shown by the provided code and test (which produced no logs because the function/path wasn’t exercised). Therefore the report is not correct for the given code/configuration.
